page.title: 18FARMING IN THE VALLEYS
page.content:
The farming in the area is mixed farming with a bias towards livestock farming. The climate is too wet and cold to produce good arable farming. There is plenty of grazing however for livestock.Cattle are grazed on the lower slopes,where the grass is of a better quality. While on the rougher moorland pastures,numerous sheep are to be found.
These sheep are ronded up in the Autumn and taken to auction or to farms on the lowland for fattening.The pasture for the cattle is not good enough for fattening either and these too are sold to lowland farms for this purpose.
The arable crops are limited mainly to root crops together with some barley.
